headlines.title: Trade deficit narrows 2.6% in July-April
headlines.intro: The country’s trade deficit narrowed by 2.60 percent in the first ten months of the current fiscal year compared to the same period a year ago, thanks to a rise in export earnings coupled with subdued imports..During the July-April period of fiscal year (FY) 2024-25, the trade gap was $18.

headlines.title: 'Amazing' Alcaraz cruises into French Open last four
headlines.intro: Reigning champion Carlos Alcaraz glided into the semi-finals of Roland Garros on Tuesday, blowing away American 12th seed Tommy Paul for the loss of just five games in the night session on Court Philippe Chatrier.

headlines.title: Living in orthodoxy: Rishad needs to rethink his MO
headlines.intro: Bangladesh leg-spinner Rishad Hossain needs to go back to the training ground and rethink how he wants to win games for the Tigers. Because what he has been dishing out in Bangladesh’s consecutive T20I tours of the UAE and Pakistan has been nothing short of ordinary.

headlines.title: Bangladesh hold Jordan to a 2-2 draw
headlines.intro: Bangladesh women's football team continued their impressive showing in the tri-nation FIFA friendly series with a 2-2 draw against hosts Jordan at King Abdullah II Stadium on Tuesday.

headlines.title: Bangladesh Football Ultras continue protest at BFF over ticket allocation
headlines.intro: The Bangladesh Football Ultras, a passionate supporters group of the national football team, continued their sit-in protest for the second consecutive day in front of the Bangladesh Football Federation (BFF) headquarters, demanding tickets for the upcoming Asian Cup Qualifier against Singapore on June 10.

headlines.title: Premier League transfer race heats up ahead of new season
headlines.intro: With the 2025-26 season still weeks away, Premier League clubs are already scrambling to strengthen their squads-- fuelled by the looming Club World Cup. Here are five names dominating the early headlines.

headlines.title: Chambers warn budget may hurt business, investment
headlines.intro: Just a day after the interim government proposed the national budget and tax measures for fiscal year 2025-26, leading business chambers expressed significant concern that several measures could potentially impede business growth and affect investment.

headlines.title: Kohli fulfils IPL dream as Royal Challengers Bengaluru beat Punjab Kings for first title
headlines.intro: Batting legend Virat Kohli top-scored for Royal Challengers Bengaluru as they beat Punjab Kings by six runs on Tuesday to win their first Indian Premier League T20 title.

Business.title: VAT hike deals fresh blow to local handset industry

News.title: Ukraine peace efforts are complex: Kremlin
News.intro: The Kremlin warned yesterday that work on trying to reach a settlement to end the war in Ukraine was extraordinarily complex and that it would be wrong to expect any imminent decisions.

News.title: New rare wild orchid seen in UK for first time in 100 years
News.intro: A new lady’s-slipper orchid, once believed to be extinct in the UK, has been spotted in the wild for the first time in 100 years following a decades-long conservation drive, experts said yesterday.

News.title: flash flooding  / Death toll in Nigeria jumps past 200
News.intro: Flash flooding in north-central Nigeria last week killed more than 200 people, the Niger state humanitarian commissioner said yesterday, while hundreds more remain missing and are feared dead.

News.title: Trump, Xi will likely speak this week
News.intro: President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping will likely speak this week, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said on Monday, days after Trump accused China of violating an agreement to roll back tariffs and trade restrictions.

News.title: Harvard seeks end to US funding cuts
News.intro: Harvard University asked a federal judge on Monday to issue a summary judgment ruling to unfreeze $2.5 billion in funding blocked by President Donald Trump’s administration, which Harvard said was illegal.

Entertainment.title: UK rapper Surya Sen enlivens Dhaka with dual debut sets
Entertainment.intro: During his first-ever trip to Dhaka last week, British-Bengali electronic producer, songwriter, and rapper Surya Sen took time out to invigorate stages with his breakout single “Buccho Ni Ba Bhai” at not one but two back-to-back debut shows in the country. This genre-hopping artiste, based in North London, brought some great UK garage, hip-hop, and house music to the table, both old and new.

Entertainment.title: Khamkheyali Sabha honours Sanjida Khatun’s legacy with memorial tribute
Entertainment.intro: In an artistic gathering, Khamkheyali Sabha, a literary and cultural forum inspired by the ideals of Rabindranath Tagore, paid tribute to the late cultural icon Sanjida Khatun through a memorial event titled ‘Sanjida Khatun Smarananjali’. The programme took place at 6:30pm, yesterday, at the World Literature Centre in Bangla Motor, Dhaka.

Life & Living.intro: Style goes beyond fashion trends—it's a personal, evolving expression of identity. Bangladeshi stylist Goutom Saha emphasizes intentional dressing, fit over flash, and sustainable choices, encouraging confidence, practicality, and grooming as the core of true personal style.

Tech & Startup.title: CD Projekt Red unveils early look at The Witcher 4 powered by Unreal Engine 5
Tech & Startup.intro: CD Projekt Red has partnered with Epic Games to present a first public demonstration of The Witcher 4 running on Unreal Engine 5, offering a glimpse of the next instalment in the acclaimed fantasy RPG franchise. The showcase opened this year’s State of Unreal keynote at Unreal Fest in Orlando, marking a key milestone in the ongoing collaboration between the two developers.

Tech & Startup.title: Why is Microsoft investing $400 million in Switzerland?
Tech & Startup.intro: Microsoft is investing $400 million in Switzerland to expand its cloud computing and artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure, the company recently announced. The company said the investment will go towards upgrading its four data centres located near Geneva and Zurich, aiming to meet the growing demand for AI and cloud services in the country.
